sentences: == Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Phillips was born Holly Michelle Gilliam on June 4, 1944, in Long Beach, California, the second child of Joyce Leone (née Poole), a Canadian-born accountant, and Gardner Burnett Gilliam, a merchant mariner from San Diego.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: She had one older sister, Russell Ann.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Phillips's paternal grandfather, Marcus Gilliam, was from Walla Walla, Washington and worked as a miner and hotelier in Erie, British Columbia.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Gilliam County, Oregon takes its name from her paternal ancestors.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Her mother suffered heart problems stemming from a childhood bout with rheumatic fever, including subacute endocarditis, and died of a related brain hemorrhage when Phillips was five years old.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Reflecting on her mother's illness, Phillips said: "They knew it was only a matter of time... She would lie on the couch in the evenings, listening as my father read to her.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: One night, after my sister and I had been put to bed, my mother just raised her head, fell unconscious on the couch, and that was it.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: "Following his wife's death, Phillips's father, wanting a change of scenery, relocated the family to Buffalo, New York, where they lived for nine months while he worked as a bartender.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: They subsequently returned to California, settling in Pasadena.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: In June 1951, two days after Phillips's seventh birthday, the family relocated again to Mexico City, Mexico, where her father had enrolled to study sociology on the GI Bill at Mexico City College.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Phillips spent the following six years in Mexico, where she attended public schools and became fluent in Spanish.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Throughout her childhood, Spanish remained Phillips's primary written language, though she later learned to write in English.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: She resided with her father and sister in the Roma Sur district of Cuauhtémoc.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Phillips recalled that her and her sister's experiences living in a different culture "helped us get over my mother's death, and instead of grieving, we became very strong, independent, and free.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: "At the age of 13, Phillips returned to the United States with her father and sister, settling again in Los Angeles.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: There, she became a childhood friend of Sue Lyon.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Phillips attended several high schools in Los Angeles, including Alexander Hamilton High School and Marshall High School.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: While a student, Phillips played several sports and studied piano, guitar, and cello.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: During her sophomore year, after being caught skipping classes and subsequently forging absence permission slips, Phillips was expelled from Marshall High School and transferred to Eagle Rock High School.In mid-1961, at age 17, Phillips relocated to San Francisco to live with her friend Tamar Hodel and began working as a model.

sentences: She appeared in a billboard advertisement for Lucky Lager beer and in print ads for Cole brand bathing suits.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Phillips quickly became immersed in San Francisco's countercultural music scene and nightlife, recalling: "Tamar and I loved going out and showing off.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: We had a friend, Eddie, Tamar's hairdresser, who was a flaming homosexual and proud of it.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Remember that this was early for gays to be obvious.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: Eddie was the first I knew and loved who was blatant.
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: He loved to do our hair and make my face up and dress me...  We didn't always have a lot of money, but I only once went to bed hungry."
section: == Life and career == | === 1944–1964: Early life ===

sentences: At a club in San Francisco in July 1961, she met John Phillips while he was touring California with his band the Journeymen, and the two began a whirlwind romance.

sentences: He divorced his first wife and married Michelle on December 31, 1962, when she was 18 years old.

sentences: == Opinions ==
section: == Opinions ==

sentences: During a 1991 interview with Arsenio Hall, Phillips advocated providing teenagers with a pragmatic education on drugs, specifically to distinguish psychedelics and marijuana from more addictive substances such as cocaine and heroin.

sentences: Though she admitted to having used LSD and marijuana in her youth, Phillips maintained that she never had experimented with other drugs, crediting the education her father instilled in her and her sister on drugs and addiction.
section: == Opinions ==

sentences: She also spoke of her belief that parents should provide their children with condoms and other contraceptives once they are aware their children are sexually active.

sentences: It was a pregnancy issue, and venereal disease...
section: == Opinions ==

sentences: I raised [my children] in the same way that I was raised myself: When I was a young girl, my father said, 'When you become sexually active, let me know, so that we can arrange for you not to get pregnant.'
section: == Opinions ==

sentences: I was raised in a very pragmatic household, and I believe that if you know your children are sexually active, then you have to try to protect them.
section: == Opinions ==

sentences: "In 2008, Phillips advocated legalization of marijuana, crediting it with helping her quit smoking cigarettes: "When I really, really, really wanted a cigarette, I would take a puff of pot, and the cravings would go away," she said.
